title: Bitcoin traders dismiss BTC price 2-week highs amid new liquidity drop
description:
Bitcoin traders are pulling support from beneath spot price now that $43,000 has been cleared, BTC price analysis shows.

Bitcoin (BTC) tapped two-week highs on Jan. 30 as traders warned of thinning order book liquidity.

Data from Cointelegraph Markets Pro and TradingView showed BTC price gains taking the market to $43,853 on Bitstamp.

A subsequent consolidation then set in, with $43,500 a focus at the time of writing after the Wall Street open.

Read more

title: App-Specific Rollup Cartesi Announces A $1 Million Ecosystem Grants Initiative
description: New York City, United States, January 30th, 2024, Chainwire Developers can receive up to $50,000 USDC per project, plus dedicated tech support, introduction to accelerators and investors, marketing support and project consulting.  Cartesi (CTSI), an app-specific rollup protocol with a virtual machine that runs Linux distributions, announced today an allocation for $1 million to the […]

title: Binance Introduces New Custody Options for Major Traders Amid Regulatory Shifts
description: In a significant move aimed at enhancing the security and flexibility of asset management for its users, Binance, one of the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, has reportedly started allowing its larger traders to store their assets with independent banks.  The strategic shift, as reported by the Financial Times, marks a departure from the conventional practice […]

title: Perpetuals DEX BBO Exchange Announces $2.7m in Pre-seed Raise
description: BBO Exchange, a new decentralized derivatives trading platform, has successfully raised $2.7 million in pre-seed funding, according to an announcement. The exchange differentiates itself as the first DEX focused on perpetuals to utilize the concept of Oracle Extractable Value (OEV) in its liquidation process, enhancing market efficiency. The funding round comes ahead of the testnet […]

title: Binance Labs Backs Puffer in a Strategic Move to Revolutionize DeFi
description: Binance Labs, the venture capital and incubation arm of the leading cryptocurrency exchange Binance, has announced a substantial investment in Puffer. The strategic move is aimed at bolstering the next generation of decentralized liquid restaking protocols. Puffer, a trailblazer in the DeFi space, is renowned for its innovative approach to combining Ethereum liquid staking with […]

title: German police confiscate $2.1b in Bitcoin from illegal file sharing
description: German authorities have confiscated approximately 50,000 Bitcoins, valued at around $2.1 billion.

title: Bitcoin Roars Past $43,000 as Tether Pumps 1 Billion USDT into Crypto Market
description: Tether’s extensive minting activity, has contributed to the recent surge in Bitcoin price moving all the way to $43,500. Fidelity’s spot Bitcoin ETF, FBTC, attracted $208 million in daily inflows, surpassing Grayscale Bitcoin Trust’s (GBTC) outflows for the first time since its launch. On Monday, January 29, the Bitcoin (BTC) price witnessed a strong surge [...]

title: Injective (INJ) and Chainlink (LINK) Surge Incoming? Analysts Tip NuggetRush (NUGX) for Staggering Growth
description: Injective and Chainlink are expected to rally alongside the broader crypto market. NuggetRush is a new P2E and governance token. According to analysts, it will experience a 5,000% jump in its price after launch. While the Bitcoin ETF market effects have been largely bearish, a strong rally is just around the corner. title: Floki Responds to “Suspicious Investment Program” Labeling by the SFC
description:
The team behind the meme-based crypto Floki has responded to the Security and Futures Commission (SFC) of Hong Kong warning, labeling it a “suspicious investment program.” In a Medium post, the Floki team stated that it is taking steps to clarify the issues, expressing regret that the SFC took such an “extreme” measure. A segment […]

The post Floki Responds to “Suspicious Investment Program” Labeling by the SFC appeared first on Coin Edition.
